medical_history.chief_complaint: Weakness and feeling cold for one day.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in her usual state of health until the afternoon of the previous day when she began to feel weak. Her sister noted that she was diffusely red. The patient describes feeling bilateral weakness, cold, shivers, and palpitations. Denies cough, chest pain, abdominal pain, constipation, diarrhea, but reports an episode of loose stools after arrival to the ED. The weakness and chills have improved in the ED, but she describes residual weakness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Atrial fibrillation on flecainide and apixaban, s/p Roux-en-Y gastric bypass, s/p cholecystectomy, hypertension, thyroid nodule, history of alcohol abuse, alopecia areata (resolved), cataract surgery, depression, hyperlipidemia, hyperparathyroidism, obesity, osteoarthritis, skin lesions, vitamin B12 deficiency, and cholecystitis.
medical_history.family_history: Father with a history of myocardial infarction (MI) at unspecified age, mother had MI and diabetes and died of cerebrovascular accident (CVA) at unspecified age, brother with diabetes, another brother with hepatitis C cirrhosis (status post liver transplant), and sister with alcoholic cirrhosis (status post liver transplant).
medical_history.social_history: Drinks 5 bottles of wine per week; denies history of alcohol withdrawal tremors, seizures, or delirium tremens; last consumed alcohol in the evening before ED visit.
